variants.Description in input context: G2019S mutation in LRRK2 associated with Parkinson's disease
E693G mutation in APP associated with Alzheimer's disease

Material used.Description: HEK293 cells were transfected with wild-type and mutant LRRK2/APP plasmids.

Readout description.Result Description: Increased kinase activity observed in LRRK2 G2019S mutant compared to wild-type.
Reduced amyloid-beta production in APP E693G mutant compared to wild-type.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed for each variant.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type plasmids were used as positive controls.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector controls were used as negative controls.

Validation method.Description: Kinase activity was validated using ATP competition assays and immunoprecipitation of LRRK2/APP complexes.

Approved method.Description: Methods were validated against established protocols in Parkinson's and Alzheimer's research.

Approved by.Description: Methods were also approved by the National Institutes of Health (NIH) for clinical research.

Approved date.Description: Validation and approval occurred in April 2023.
